kpi_info.title: period_duration (period_duration)
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: TOTAL_ERROR_CODE (M145B2C1)
kpi_info.use: Error code concerning the whole report. Zero value means a successful report, non-zero value indicates that no counters are present. The value is a general DX error code in decimal format. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: DIST_ERROR_CODE (M145B2C2)
kpi_info.use: Error code concerning the short disturbances counters. Zero value means a successful report, non-zero value indicates that no disturbance counters are present. The value is a general DX error code in decimal format. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRA_ERROR_CODE (M145B2C3)
kpi_info.use: Error code concerning the frame alignment error counters. Zero value means a successful report, non-zero value indicates that no frame alignment counters are present. The value is a general DX error code in decimal format. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: SLIP_ERROR_CODE (M145B2C4)
kpi_info.use: Error code concerning the slip counters. Zero value means a successful report, non-zero value indicates that no slip counters are present. The value is a general DX error code in decimal format. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: CRC_ERROR_CODE (M145B2C5)
kpi_info.use: Error code concerning the CRC counters. Zero value means a successful report, non-zero value indicates that no CRC counters are present. The value is a general DX error code in decimal format. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: DISTURB_CTR_1_LOWER_LIMIT (M145B2C6)
kpi_info.use: The limits for statistics counters of disturbances. The disturbances are recorded according to the duration of the disturbance. This field indicates the limits expressed in milliseconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: DISTURB_CTR_1_UPPER_LIMIT (M145B2C7)
kpi_info.use: The limits for statistics counters of disturbances. The disturbances are recorded according to the duration of the disturbance. This field indicates the limits expressed in milliseconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: DISTURB_CTR_2_LOWER_LIMIT (M145B2C8)
kpi_info.use: The limits for statistics counters of disturbances. The disturbances are recorded according to the duration of the disturbance. This field indicates the limits expressed in milliseconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: DISTURB_CTR_2_UPPER_LIMIT (M145B2C9)
kpi_info.use: The limits for statistics counters of disturbances. The disturbances are recorded according to the duration of the disturbance. This field indicates the limits expressed in milliseconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: DISTURB_CTR_3_LOWER_LIMIT (M145B2C10)
kpi_info.use: The limits for statistics counters of disturbances. The disturbances are recorded according to the duration of the disturbance. This field indicates the limits expressed in milliseconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: DISTURB_CTR_3_UPPER_LIMIT (M145B2C11)
kpi_info.use: The limits for statistics counters of disturbances. The disturbances are recorded according to the duration of the disturbance. This field indicates the limits expressed in milliseconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: DISTURB_CTR_4_LOWER_LIMIT (M145B2C12)
kpi_info.use: The limits for statistics counters of disturbances. The disturbances are recorded according to the duration of the disturbance. This field indicates the limits expressed in milliseconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: IN_SIGNAL_MISSING_CTR_1 (M145B2C13)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'incoming signal missing' disturbances of group 1. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: IN_SIGNAL_MISSING_CTR_2 (M145B2C14)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'incoming signal missing' disturbances of group 2. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: IN_SIGNAL_MISSING_CTR_3 (M145B2C15)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'incoming signal missing' disturbances of group 3. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: IN_SIGNAL_MISSING_CTR_4 (M145B2C16)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'incoming signal missing' disturbances of group 4. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRAME_ALIGNMENT_LOST_CTR_1 (M145B2C17)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'frame alignment signal lost' disturbances of group 1. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRAME_ALIGNMENT_LOST_CTR_2 (M145B2C18)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'frame alignment signal lost' disturbances of group 2. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRAME_ALIGNMENT_LOST_CTR_3 (M145B2C19)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'frame alignment signal lost' disturbances of group 3. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRAME_ALIGNMENT_LOST_CTR_4 (M145B2C20)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'frame alignment signal lost' disturbances of group 4. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: AIS_RECEIVED_CTR_1 (M145B2C21)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'AIS received' disturbances of group 1. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: AIS_RECEIVED_CTR_2 (M145B2C22)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'AIS received' disturbances of group 2. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: AIS_RECEIVED_CTR_3 (M145B2C23)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'AIS received' disturbances of group 3. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: AIS_RECEIVED_CTR_4 (M145B2C24)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'AIS received' disturbances of group 4. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_ALARM_CTR_1 (M145B2C25)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'remote end alarm' disturbances of group 1. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_ALARM_CTR_2 (M145B2C26)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'remote end alarm' disturbances of group 2. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_ALARM_CTR_3 (M145B2C27)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'remote end alarm' disturbances of group 3. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_ALARM_CTR_4 (M145B2C28)
kpi_info.use: The number of 'remote end alarm' disturbances of group 4. Disturbances are divided into four groups according to the duration of the disturbance. The disturbance limits are defined in the M145B2C6-M145B2C12 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRA_CTR_1_LOWER_LIMIT (M145B2C49)
kpi_info.use: Limits for the statistics counters of frame alignment loss. The bit error ratio is based on the erroneous frame alignment signals received during five seconds. The field indicates the counter limits (errors/5 seconds). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRA_CTR_1_UPPER_LIMIT (M145B2C50)
kpi_info.use: Limits for the statistics counters of frame alignment loss. The bit error ratio is based on the erroneous frame alignment signals received during five seconds. The field indicates the counter limits (errors/5 seconds). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRA_CTR_2_LOWER_LIMIT (M145B2C51)
kpi_info.use: Limits for the statistics counters of frame alignment loss. The bit error ratio is based on the erroneous frame alignment signals received during five seconds. The field indicates the counter limits (errors/5 seconds). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRA_CTR_2_UPPER_LIMIT (M145B2C52)
kpi_info.use: Limits for the statistics counters of frame alignment loss. The bit error ratio is based on the erroneous frame alignment signals received during five seconds. The field indicates the counter limits (errors/5 seconds). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRA_CTR_3_LOWER_LIMIT (M145B2C53)
kpi_info.use: Limits for the statistics counters of frame alignment loss. The bit error ratio is based on the erroneous frame alignment signals received during five seconds. The field indicates the counter limits (errors/5 seconds). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRA_CTR_3_UPPER_LIMIT (M145B2C54)
kpi_info.use: Limits for the statistics counters of frame alignment loss. The bit error ratio is based on the erroneous frame alignment signals received during five seconds. The field indicates the counter limits (errors/5 seconds). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRA_CTR_4_LOWER_LIMIT (M145B2C55)
kpi_info.use: Limits for the statistics counters of frame alignment loss. The bit error ratio is based on the erroneous frame alignment signals received during five seconds. The field indicates the counter limits (errors/5 seconds). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRAME_ALIGNMENT_ERROR_CTR_1 (M145B2C56)
kpi_info.use: Counter 1 for frame alignment errors. The errors are counted using four counters depending on the number of errors within five seconds. The error limits are defined in the M145B2C49-M145B2C55 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRAME_ALIGNMENT_ERROR_CTR_2 (M145B2C57)
kpi_info.use: Counter 2 for frame alignment errors. The errors are counted using four counters depending on the number of errors within five seconds. The error limits are defined in the M145B2C49-M145B2C55 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRAME_ALIGNMENT_ERROR_CTR_3 (M145B2C58)
kpi_info.use: Counter 3 for frame alignment errors. The errors are counted using four counters depending on the number of errors within five seconds. The error limits are defined in the M145B2C49-M145B2C55 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: FRAME_ALIGNMENT_ERROR_CTR_4 (M145B2C59)
kpi_info.use: Counter 4 for frame alignment errors. The errors are counted using four counters depending on the number of errors within five seconds. The error limits are defined in the M145B2C49-M145B2C55 fields. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: NEGATIVE_SLIPS (M145B2C60)
kpi_info.use: The counter value for negative slips. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: POSITIVE_SLIPS (M145B2C61)
kpi_info.use: The counter value for positive slips. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: LOCAL_END_TOTAL_TIME (M145B2C62)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: total time at the local end, given in 1/100 seconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: LOCAL_END_AVAIL_TIME (M145B2C63)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: availability time at the local end, given in 1/100 seconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: LOCAL_END_UNAVAIL_TIME (M145B2C64)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: unavailability time at the local end, given in 1/100 seconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: LOCAL_END_DEGRADED_MINUTES (M145B2C65)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of degraded minutes at the local end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: LOCAL_END_ERRORED_SECONDS (M145B2C66)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of errored seconds at the local end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: LOCAL_END_ERROR_FREE_SEC (M145B2C67)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of error free seconds at the local end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: LOCAL_END_SER_ERRORED_SEC (M145B2C68)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of seriously errored seconds at the local end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: LOCAL_END_BBE (M145B2C69)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of background block errors at the local end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_TOTAL_TIME (M145B2C70)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: total time at the remote end, given in 1/100 seconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_AVAIL_TIME (M145B2C71)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: availability time at the remote end, given in 1/100 seconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_UNAVAIL_TIME (M145B2C72)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: unavailability time at the remote end, given in 1/100 seconds. UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_DEGRADED_MINUTES (M145B2C73)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of degraded minutes at the remote end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_ERRORED_SECONDS (M145B2C74)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of errored seconds at the remote end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_ERROR_FREE_SEC (M145B2C75)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of error free seconds at the remote end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_SER_ERRORED_SEC (M145B2C76)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of seriously errored seconds at the remote end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100). UPDATED:

kpi_info.title: REMOTE_END_BBE (M145B2C77)
kpi_info.use: CRC measurement: percentage of background block errors at the remote end, given in 1/100 percents (the percentage value multiplied with 100).
